greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Sum_{n>=0} 1/(3*n+1)^2.
comment: Sum over the inverse squares of A016777. Dirichlet series Sum_{n>=1} A079978(n-1)/n^s at s=2.
This is also (1/9)*Zeta(2, 1/3) = (1/9)*Psi(1, 1/3) with the Hurwitz Zeta Function Zeta(s, a) and the Polygamma function Psi(n, z). See the programs. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Nov 12 2017
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Hurwitz Zeta Function .
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Polygamma Function.
formula: Equals (A086724 + A214549)/2 because the sequence represented by A079978 (with offset 1) is the average of A011655 and A102283.
Equals Integral_{0..1} log(x)/(x^3-1) dx = Integral_{1..oo} x*log(x)/(x^3-1) dx.
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 20 2012
